Posts.EditableText: [img:hta2c50i]http://s009.radikal.ru/i309/1501/dc/7cc1cfa8dc3e.jpg[/img:hta2c50i] Through the dense fog our hero noticed a dark silhouette of a dark castle. Eventually his old rain-soaked map brought him to his target. He didn't have anything with him except for his favorite sword and remainings of an old armor with an unusual device – a sword-breaker. The hero looked around and stepped on the castle bridge... The plot of this game is a story of a hero with an unusual and complicated life, who looks for treasures in an abandoned castle. On his way he is going to overcome lots of obstacles, fight the most unusual enemies, and solve the mysteries that are happening in the castle. In the end of it all he will get the treasures he deserves! This game is a representative of quite a rare genre – interactive comic strips with exceedingly beautiful illustrations by a professional artist, and interesting nonlinear storyline. All actions and decisions in the game will change a storyline and the ending of the game. Every player's action will change the main hero's karma, so everyone can finish the game their own way. The achievement system will reward curious players with a big reward. Sometimes, you will have to make the most unusual decisions to survive... Every decision can be your last! [b:hta2c50i]In our game you get: [/b:hta2c50i] - Interesting, nonlinear storyline. - Variety of the game endings. - The huge and mysterious castle. - Variety of interesting locations and situations. - Interesting enemies and castle inhabitants. - Unbelievably beautiful illustrations. - Achievements [b:hta2c50i]Release in Steam:[/b:hta2c50i] [url:hta2c50i]http://store.steampowered.com/app/411760[/url:hta2c50i] [b:hta2c50i]Release in PlayMarket:[/b:hta2c50i] [url:hta2c50i]https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.swordbreaker2.game.android[/url:hta2c50i] [b:hta2c50i]Watch our new trailer![/b:hta2c50i] [url:hta2c50i]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uKANNwSMrvs[/url:hta2c50i] Join! Our public: https://www.facebook.com/groups/swordbreakergame/ Our site: http://ducats-games.com/swordbreaker-the-game/ [img:hta2c50i]http://s011.radikal.ru/i317/1506/f9/0093e509d0d2.jpg[/img:hta2c50i] [img:hta2c50i]http://s019.radikal.ru/i639/1311/9e/86625e280256.jpg[/img:hta2c50i] [img:hta2c50i]http://s020.radikal.ru/i723/1311/7d/26383f1795dd.jpg[/img:hta2c50i] [img:hta2c50i]http://i017.radikal.ru/1311/59/d96a9bad25b5.jpg[/img:hta2c50i]
Posts.HTML:
Through the dense fog our hero noticed a dark silhouette of a dark castle. Eventually his old rain-soaked map brought him to his target. He didn't have anything with him except for his favorite sword and remainings of an old armor with an unusual device – a sword-breaker. The hero looked around and stepped on the castle bridge...

The plot of this game is a story of a hero with an unusual and complicated life, who looks for treasures in an abandoned castle. On his way he is going to overcome lots of obstacles, fight the most unusual enemies, and solve the mysteries that are happening in the castle. In the end of it all he will get the treasures he deserves!

This game is a representative of quite a rare genre – interactive comic strips with exceedingly beautiful illustrations by a professional artist, and interesting nonlinear storyline. All actions and decisions in the game will change a storyline and the ending of the game. Every player's action will change the main hero's karma, so everyone can finish the game their own way. The achievement system will reward curious players with a big reward. Sometimes, you will have to make the most unusual decisions to survive... Every decision can be your last!

In our game you get:
- Interesting, nonlinear storyline.
- Variety of the game endings.
- The huge and mysterious castle.
- Variety of interesting locations and situations.
- Interesting enemies and castle inhabitants.
- Unbelievably beautiful illustrations.
- Achievements

Release in Steam: http://store.steampowered.com/app/411760
Release in PlayMarket: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.swordbreaker2.game.android

Watch our new trailer!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uKANNwSMrvs

Join!
Our public: https://www.facebook.com/groups/swordbreakergame/
Our site: http://ducats-games.com/swordbreaker-the-game/

Before you do anything else, you really need to get your "professional translator" on the job. Your website is riddled with typos and wrong word usage and very offputting. It doesn't come across as professional at all or the kind of thing a respectable games company would do. "Sometimes any logic has to be rejected and help only curiosity and an independent way of thinking of the Player can!" from your website makes no sense at all.

Posts.EditableText: Hello guys! Sorry for this english mistakes, but all we have right now it two people (me and author of scenario plus our greatest illustrator, lulz), and game at the moment sponsored by two of us. So it comes to conclusion - "We don't have enough resources to do extra professional translation for 10+ different languages". BUT don't worry - all text in game was made by professional freelancer, we don't even try to do translation of such big amount of text (300+ scenes) ourself. I hope you, players, can say to us - good our translator or not. As for site... Well, yeah)) I rewrite it as I have time to this - right now I doing last preparations for code in demo. Thanks for your replies guys, this forum one of few, that somebody answer to us)) Maybe we post story intro video here, you can watch it and "taste" translation. Best regards, Mike.
Posts.HTML:
Hello guys! Sorry for this english mistakes, but all we have right now it two people (me and author of scenario plus our greatest illustrator, lulz), and game at the moment sponsored by two of us. So it comes to conclusion - "We don't have enough resources to do extra professional translation for 10+ different languages". BUT don't worry - all text in game was made by professional freelancer, we don't even try to do translation of such big amount of text (300+ scenes) ourself. I hope you, players, can say to us - good our translator or not.

As for site... Well, yeah)) I rewrite it as I have time to this - right now I doing last preparations for code in demo.

Thanks for your replies guys, this forum one of few, that somebody answer to us)) Maybe we post story intro video here, you can watch it and "taste" translation.

Best regards, Mike.

Posts.EditableText: I gave it a quick look - I like the styling and how the gui works. As for the writing - there's some issues such as at the store page it says trasures rather than treasures and the translator doesn't appear to know about the apostrophe and the possessive s... that aside it isn't unreadable although the descriptions read more like a translation than how someone more fluid in English might have constructed them. Quite a nice app, I'll probably buy the finished thing.

A lot of work on game scenes is made already. Still slightly we will add an art)
We took into account your responses concerning music (it wasn't pleasant to much) and we can tell that it will be partially or is completely replaced + a lot more melodies that the melody didn't seem monotonous will be added.
So wait! Already relatively soon!

Posts.EditableText: The long-awaited event has come true! Our game Swordbreaker The Game came to PlayMarket open spaces: https://play.google.com/store/apps/deta ... me.android Now all owners of devices on the basis of the Android OS can play it. We long reflected on that to make game paid or free and have stopped on paid option. In game achievements also work.
Posts.HTML:
The long-awaited event has come true!
Our game Swordbreaker The Game came to PlayMarket open spaces: https://play.google.com/store/apps/deta ... me.android
Now all owners of devices on the basis of the Android OS can play it. We long reflected on that to make game paid or free and have stopped on paid option.
In game achievements also work.

Posts.EditableText:
Ok. I don't know if i should be already typing this, but lets go.

I did buy the game, but only played it for 15 minutes, what means i cannot talk much about the story itself.

The best things are the images and the sound track. The images are very competent. I do not think it should deserve an award, as illustration, but it is very cool. The sound track is the best. Very interesting and looks to be very well used.

May people here already pointed the text problems. I believe it begins when you can only get introduction movie on Russian or whatever be that language. Polish, perhaps? You may only change game to English after the opening video, what suggests there is not an English option. Ok, lets move on. It doesn't matters.

But, hey? Why doesn't matters? Because as you can feel at the very beginning of the game, there is only a barely believable argument for the character entering into a castle and steal everything. The game was designed to be a dungeon crawling without many motivations or character deep development. The character is treated as "our hero", what means it has absolutely no name. No personality. No nothing. It is ok for old games and many theorists even prefer this lack of character, as it allows player to fill the gaps himself / herself. However the game also gives you no motivation. The idea is you get inside and steal everything. "Here" her is a dubious term, as the guy is a burglar. 

Then problems follows. One guy somewhere pointed it was a crap having to click on text in order to scroll it down. Actually, i thing is not an issue at all. The real problem is that the player gets absolutely vey few texts and very few information. The game offers at each step two or three options where the player must just guess things. There is no real information. Do you want to get the skeleton's sword, the game asks? "I don't know" is the most proper option - not possible in the actual game - because you have just a clue abou the character's items based on the pictures displayed. The dungeon crawling games simply lacks a system where player would base choices knowing about the character. As the text also gives no clues, the player must just guess about the options. This is very uncomfortable.

As a good point, there is always a picture illustrating every single scene, and every single move. The artist worked a lot for this game, and actually did a good job!

You may only expect to be walking around a huge castle as monsters pops in front of "our hero" as the player must guess how to deal with them. Each scene has not many steps. I mean, when planning what i call myself "conflicts" - a situation where player must make choices in order to outcome any kind of oppositions, be it a fight, a discussion, a persuasion task - there are steps. You win this little particle of the conflict and takes an edge, and then goes to the next step until you get victory somehow. Most of the conflicts are split into two steps or "all or nothing" steps. Do not even bother trying to figure out if there is a certain course of action more effective. There is no system to encourage you acting a given way or a good text indicating what would be best doing.

In short, the game has impressive props and a very competent design. But a poor planning. And a terrible text. Seems while a team was working on good pictures and an inspiring music, the head developer was concerned about making it big. Just big, like the old times quality measure for parser games - the number of rooms!
